chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: nat
x: nat
q: nat

Goal:
q <> 0 -> q * x = q * y -> x = y

Premises:

in_fractran_0 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y
fractran_step_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> SProp, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
fractran_step_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
Inductive fractran_step : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop := in_fractran_0 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y | in_fractran_1 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y Arguments fractran_step _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_0 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_1 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope

prime_seq.power_factor_lt_neq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> i < j -> ~ divides p x -> p ^ i * x <> p ^ j * y
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.gcd_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Nat.gcd_unique x y (Nat.gcd x' y') (Nat.gcd_nonneg x' y') ((fun lemma : x = x' => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.divide_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive (Nat.gcd x' y')) x x' lemma) Hx (Nat.gcd_divide_l x' y')) ((fun lemma : y = y' => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.divide_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation...
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, divides x y -> divides y z -> divides x z
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q -> q = a / b
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
own_multiple : forall x p : nat, x = p * x -> x = 0 \/ p = 1
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
prime.prime_rect : forall P : nat -> Type, P 0 -> P 1 -> (forall p : nat, prime.prime p -> P p) -> (forall x y : nat, P x -> P y -> P (x * y)) -> forall n : nat, P n
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
prime.prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime.prime _%nat_scope
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
divides_le : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> divides p q -> p <= q
Nat.div_lt_upper_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a < b * q -> a / b < q
Nat.div_le_lower_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> b * q <= a -> q <= a / b
Nat.div_le_upper_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a <= b * q -> a / b <= q
div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n

```coq
intros Hq Hqxqy.
apply prime_seq.inv_exp with (p1:=x) (p2:=y).
- auto.
- intro H; apply Nat.divide_mul_split with (n:=q) (m:=x) (p:=1) in H; destruct H as [q1 [r1 [Hqx1 Hq1r1]]]; rewrite Hqx1 in Hqxqy; injection Hqxqy; intros; subst; contradiction.
- intro H; apply Nat.divide_mul_split with (n:=q) (m:=y) (p:=1) in H; destruct H as [q1 [r1 [Hqy1 Hq1r1]]]; rewrite Hqy1 in Hqxqy; injection Hqxqy; intros; subst; contradiction.
- auto.
Qed.```
